kou commented on issue #2288: ARROW-2875: [Packaging] Don't attempt to download arrow archive in linux builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2288#issuecomment-406125467
 
 
   It may not be a good change.
   I think that we should use the official source archive for released package instead of building a source archive for packaging.
   
   BTW, if we don't use the official source archive at www.apache.org, we should remove related codes instead of commenting out them.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #2288: ARROW-2875: [Packaging] Don't attempt to download arrow archive in linux builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2288#issuecomment-406131279
 
 
   I read https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/ARROW/Release+Management+Guide .
   In our release process, we release the official source archive by `dev/release/02-source.sh` then we release other packages such as packages for Java and Python. So I think that we can download the official source archive from www.apache.org.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2288#issuecomment-406131719
 
 
   We should have a way to switch between development builds (use snapshots from git) and release builds (use apache.org source archive from the dist system)

kszucs commented on issue #2288: ARROW-2875: [Packaging] Don't attempt to download arrow archive in linux builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2288#issuecomment-406572631
 
 
   @kou I think We should enable `building from source archive` feature for all of the builds, including conda, wheel etc. 
   
   How about adding a new target in crossbow, to build (and verify) apache source archives instead of a git repository?
   
   

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #2288: ARROW-2875: [Packaging] Don't attempt to download arrow archive in linux builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2288#issuecomment-406824106
 
 
   > I think We should enable `building from source archive` feature for all of the builds, including conda, wheel etc.
   
   Ah, I missed it. I considered only .deb/.rpm. Sorry. I agree with you. 
   
   > How about adding a new target in crossbow, to build (and verify) apache source archives instead of a git repository?
   
   It looks good to me. #2295 will help it. If we specify `ARROW_VERSION=0.10.0`, `ARROW_VERSION=0.10.0-rc1` and so on, .deb/.rpm building tasks download a source archive and use it.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on issue #2288: ARROW-2875: [Packaging] Don't attempt to download arrow archive in linux builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2288#issuecomment-406871417
 
 
   @wesm thoughts? I'm planning something like:
   
   `python crossbow.py submit --from-archive --version 0.10.0` 
   or 
   `python crossbow.py submit --from-archive <apache resource link>` (need to parse version number)

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kszucs edited a comment on issue #2288: ARROW-2875: [Packaging] Don't attempt to download arrow archive in linux builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2288#issuecomment-406871417
 
 
   @wesm thoughts? I'm planning something like:
   
   `python crossbow.py submit --source-archive --version 0.10.0` 
   or 
   `python crossbow.py submit --source-archive <apache resource link>` (need to parse version number)
   
   We'd have to kinds of `target`: `GitTarget` and e.g. `SourceTarget`

kszucs commented on issue #2288: ARROW-2875: [Packaging] Don't attempt to download arrow archive in linux builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2288#issuecomment-407169667
 
 
   Currently crossbow does this implicitly if that tag is checked out in the local arrow repository.
   However this conflicts with @kou's recent PR https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2295

----------------------------------------------------------------

kszucs edited a comment on issue #2288: ARROW-2875: [Packaging] Don't attempt to download arrow archive in linux builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2288#issuecomment-407169667
 
 
   Currently crossbow does this implicitly if that tag is checked out in the local arrow repository.
   However this conflicts with @kou's recent PR https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2295
   
   For clean version numbers it'll attempt to download the apache archive, that's why I've commented it out.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org
